title: Yamamoto follows Snell with rare feat in L.A. win
content: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched a three-hitter for the first postseason complete game in eight years as the Dodgers beat Milwaukee 5-1 on Tuesday night to extend their lead in the National League Championship Series.

title: Trump threatens to remove WC games from Boston

content: Varthur-Panathur residents allege that drainage lines were being linked to sewage manholes, causing backflow during heavy rains. They said newly resurfaced stretches, particularly on Panathur Main Road, were getting flooded because of faulty gradient design.

content: RMC on Tuesday noted that the simultaneous withdrawal of the Southwest monsoon and the onset of Northeast monsoon was likely by Thursday; WRD plans to release water from Poondi and Red Hills reservoirs on Wednesday afternoon depending on rainfall and inflow

title: Three militants arrested in Manipur for extortion

title: College Street publishers still recovering from sight of never-before deluge that dampened their Durga Puja
content: The loss is sinking in even more now as normal life resumes after the Durga Puja holidays ‚Äî which began almost immediately after the massive flooding ‚Äî with most of their employees returning to work and the shops once again looking back at the damage

title: Telangana mandates Diethylene Glycol, Ethylene Glycol testing for all syrups
content: To ensure thorough quality assurance, manufacturers have been directed to sample and test every individual container or pack of excipients upon receipt of raw materials.

title: Video: Zubeen Garg's Fans Throw Stones As Accused Moved To Another Prison
content: A massive protest broke out outside an Assam prison as the five people, who were arrested in connection with the death of singer Zubeen Garg in Singapore last month, were relocated on Wednesday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Not Nitish, Not Tejashwi - These 11 Forces Will Decide Bihar's Fate
content: Multiple alliances, shifting voter demographics, welfare schemes, caste calculations, and the emergence of new political players have created a multifaceted contest where traditional voting patterns may no longer hold.

title: Cloud Seeding In Delhi Likely In 2-3 Days As Air Quality Dips Ahead Of Diwali
content: Cloud seeding is the process of adding special substances like silver iodide and dry ice to clouds to make it rain or snow in areas experiencing water scarcity, less snowfall, or to reduce hail and clear fog.

title: Bengal Voter Mapping Process Sees Little Progress, 7 Districts Finish Task
content: The West Bengal district election officers (DEOs) have mapped electors only in seven of the 24 districts, despite being instructed to complete the process by Tuesday, Deputy Election Commissioner Gyanesh Bharti said on Wednesday.

title: "Since Crackers Smuggled In...": Why Supreme Court Gave Big Go-Ahead
content: Firecrackers smuggled in from outside Delhi NCR during Diwali cause more damage than green crackers, the Supreme Court said today, while allowing the bursting of green crackers in Delhi between October 18 and 21.

title: Drugs Worth $170 Million, Guns Seized In Raid Linked To 'Kill Team'
content: Australian police said Wednesday they had seized drugs worth $170 million and guns in a raid on a group likely linked to an attempted organised crime hit near a Sydney daycare facility last week.

title: Bengaluru Citizens Say Won't Pay Tax Over "Poor Infra", DK Shivakumar Responds
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar on Wednesday said the work of filling potholes in Bengaluru is "progressing swiftly", even as a group of citizens threatened to stop paying property tax.

title: "Puppets Sold Pakistan": Internet Slams Shehbaz Sharif For Trump's 'Flattery'
content: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif turned the Gaza Summit in Egypt into a Donald Trump fanfare convention, as he heaped praises on the US President, calling him a "man of peace".

title: He Slaughtered An Elderly Couple, Then Stole A Signed New York Yankees Ball
content: A 42-year-old man accused of killing an elderly couple during a horrifying home invasion in New York City in September had fled with a valuable 2001 New York Yankees baseball from the victims' home, prosecutors said Tuesday.

title: In 1977, A Man Attempted To Kill Girlfriend. 48 Years Later, He Is Arrested
content: The accused, identified as 71-year-old Chandrashekhar Madhukar Kalekar, was arrested from a residence in Dapoli, Ratnagiri district. He was 23 years old at the time of the alleged crime.

title: These 4 Indian Birds Are At Risk Of Extinction
content: The Long-billed Grasshopper-warbler is now classified as endangered, while Indian Courser, Indian Roller and Rufous-tailed Lark are listed as 'Near Threatened'.

title: 5 Suspects In Zubeen Garg's Death Case Sent To Jail For 14 Days
content: The five accused in the death of iconic singer Zubeen Garg case have been sent to 14-day judicial custody by a local court in Guwahati after the end of their CID remand.

title: Russia Makes Precise Drones, Uses To Attack Ukraines Vital Rail Network
content: Russia has stepped up railway attacks over the past three months, seeking to sow unrest in Ukrainian regions it borders by depriving people there of rail connections, Oleksandr Pertsovskyi, the CEO of the Ukrainian state railway, said.

title: Pakistan Reports Fresh Clash With Afghan Forces Following "Unprovoked Fire"
content: Clashes erupted Tuesday between Pakistani and Afghan forces in a remote northwestern border region, with state-run media in Pakistan accusing Afghan troops of opening "unprovoked fire" that was repulsed.

title: Hamas Brutally Executes 8 Gazans In Public Amid Trump's 'Disarm' Warning
content: Hamas is reportedly carrying out mass public executions in Gaza as it desperately seeks to maintain control over the Palestinian enclave, even as US President Donald Trump has vowed to disarm the group.

title: AI Chatbots That Talk Like Humans Pose Threat To India's Call-Centre Workers
content: At a startup office in this Indian city, developers are fine-tuning artificial-intelligence chatbots that talk and message like humans.

title: Walmart Partners With OpenAI To Offer Shopping On ChatGPT
content: Users will be able to shop Walmart's assortment directly on ChatGPT by clicking a "buy" button. The catalog includes apparel, entertainment, packaged food and other products from Walmart and its Sam's Club chain.

content: A woman and her daughter have been arrested for stealing a newborn from Burdwan Medical College and Hospital in West Bengal, police said on Wednesday.

content: The Janata Dal Secular has accused the Congress of casting a shadow over IT hub Bengaluru, hours after Andhra Pradesh emerged as the chosen site for Google's biggest ever investment in the country.

content: The long-pending matter raises concerns over stagnation in career progression and disparities in pay and promotional opportunities among officers in the subordinate judiciary.

content: JSP national president Uday Singh handed the party symbol to Chanchal Singh for Raghopur, an assembly seat in Vaishali district

content: A petaflop is a unit of measurement for computer processing speed, representing one quadrillion floating-point operations per second.

content: Several unsuspecting individuals were deceitfully appointed as directors in these companies under the guise of part-time employment in e-commerce or fintech operations

content: The Director General of Military Operations says Pakistan‚Äôs posthumous gallantry medals proves high number of casualties; says India achieved its political and military goals through targeted operations

content: Peacekeepers today face increasingly complex challenges, from volatile environments marked by terrorism to humanitarian crises, Rajnath Singh said at the Chiefs‚Äô Conclave of the United Nations Troop Contributing Countries, being hosted by India for the first time

content: For the second time in six months, the top court questions ED‚Äôs conduct in the case; ‚Äúwhat happens to the federal structure,‚Äù asks CJI Gavai

content: He condemns the Kerala government and Save Kerala Brigade for filing a petition seeking permission to demolish the dam

content: He alleges that the ‚Äògrowing spread of narcotic drugs‚Äô is the major reason for the rise in such criminal activities

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta to campaign for Bihar Assembly election
content: The outcome of the Bihar election will depend heavily on voting by women, and Gupta is a good orator who connects with the audience through her straight talk, a party leader said

title: India to train border security force of Mongolia: PM Modi
content: The PM highlights common Buddhist bonds between Mongolia and India and says India will start issuing free e-visas for Mongolian citizens

title: CMC launches specialised team for patients affected with blood clot
content: According to a press release, the team was started to mark World Thrombosis Day, observed annually on October 13, and a global awareness campaign initiated by the International Society on Thrombosis and Haemostasis (ISTH) in 2014.

title: 61 Maoists, including top leader Bhupati, surrender in Maharashtra
content: A senior official said that with Bhupati‚Äôs surrender, ‚Äúthe core family of the Naxal movement‚Äù has ended and that it is a ‚Äúmajor step in the elimination‚Äù of the insurgency

title: Af-Pak border clash rages: Taliban captures tanks & outposts - new visuals emerge
content: Intense border clashes erupted between Afghanistan and Pakistan along border area, claiming 15 Afghan civilian lives and leaving many injured. Both nations reported inflicting damage on the other's military assets, including tanks, weapons and posts. This escalation follows recent reciprocal strikes and ongoing disputes over border security and alleged militant harboring.

title: Indian-origin US adviser held: Why he‚Äôs under scrutiny; what FBI found at his home
content: An Indian-origin scholar, identified as Tellis, has been detained by US authorities on charges of unlawfully retaining over 1,000 pages of classified national defense information. The documents, marked "SECRET" and "TOP SECRET," were discovered at his Virginia home. Authorities also allege Tellis met with Chinese officials multiple times.

title: 'Vijay was 7 hrs late': Stalin blames TVK chief for congestion that led to Karur stampede
content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin blamed crowd management and actor-politician Vijay for the Karur tragedy that killed 41. He highlighted the delay in Vijay's arrival, inadequate facilities, and organizers' refusal to halt the caravan against police advice, leading to severe congestion and deaths. The government has initiated investigations and compensation.

title: Jaisalmer bus tragedy: How vehicle bought 5 days ago became death trap
content: A private bus, recently converted to AC, erupted in flames near Jaisalmer, claiming 20 lives, including three children. A suspected short circuit in the AC system caused the rapid spread of fire, trapping passengers. Rescue efforts were hampered by intense heat. Investigations into the bus operator and modification are underway.

title: BCCI makes huge blunder, mixes up Sarfaraz Khan with brother Musheer Khan
content: The BCCI's Ranji Trophy 2025 season began with an embarrassing mix-up, mistakenly listing star batter Sarfaraz Khan as dismissed for a duck. The error, which saw his younger brother Musheer Khan actually get out, caused widespread confusion online before the scorecard was corrected. This incident highlighted human error's impact despite digital advancements.

title: TCS layoffs: HR chief clarifies; ‚ÄòWe are not chasing a target‚Äô
content: Tata Consultancy Services HR head Sudeep Kunnumal addressed layoff concerns. He clarified that TCS is not targeting job cuts but will evaluate all employees. The company has seen a 1% workforce reduction, with further evaluations planned for those who cannot be redeployed. Kunnumal also mentioned TCS's localized US workforce and adaptability to H-1B visa rule changes.

title: ‚ÄòMahabharat‚Äô star Pankaj Dheer passes away at 68 after long battle with cancer
content: Veteran actor Pankaj Dheer, who captivated audiences as Karna in the epic 'Mahabharat', has passed away at 68. He succumbed to cancer after a prolonged illness. Dheer was celebrated for his powerful performances across television and film. His son Nikitin Dheer and daughter-in-law Kratika Sengar continue his artistic legacy. Dheer's iconic role as Karna remains unforgettable.

title: 'No winners in trade conflicts': China hits back at US; defends rare earths curbs
content: China has retorted to US President Trump's threat of halting cooking oil imports, stating trade conflicts benefit no one. This follows Beijing's suspension of US soybean purchases, which Trump called an "economically hostile act." The US was China's largest customer for used cooking oil last year, highlighting the significant trade ties at stake amidst escalating tensions.

title: WTC standings shake-up: Pakistan move past India; end South Africa‚Äôs winning streak
content: Pakistan stunned world champions South Africa by 93 runs in the first Test, ending their 10-match winning streak. Noman Ali's spin wizardry, taking 10 wickets, and Shaheen Afridi's pace proved too much for the Proteas. This victory propels Pakistan to second in the World Test Championship standings.

title: Elon Musk‚Äôs u-turn on Bitcoin: calls it ‚Äòbased on energy‚Äô; sparks crypto debate
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has reversed his stance on Bitcoin, now championing its energy-based foundation as a key to its long-term value. Musk stated that unlike fiat currency, energy cannot be faked, making Bitcoin trustworthy. This marks a significant shift from his previous environmental concerns regarding the cryptocurrency.

title: KBC Junior contestant wins Rs 7.5L for answering a cricket question: Do you know the answer?
content: A recent Kaun Banega Crorepati episode featured a Rs 7.5 lakh question about a statue unveiling at Wankhede Stadium in August. The Mumbai Cricket Association honoured a legend of the sport for his significant contributions to cricket, adding to the stadium's rich history. This KBC question highlighted the cultural blend of cricket and entertainment in India.

title: Cryptocurrency rates today: Bitcoin steadies above $112k after brief dip
content: Bitcoin experienced a brief dip below $110,000 before recovering, signaling cautious market behavior. While Ethereum saw a slight increase, several other major cryptocurrencies declined. The overall market value decreased, influenced by US-China trade tensions and potential Fed rate cut hints amidst inflation concerns.

title: Digital rights debate: SC rejects doctor‚Äôs WhatsApp plea; suggests using Zoho‚Äôs Arattai
content: The Supreme Court of India has ruled that access to private messaging platforms like WhatsApp is not a fundamental right, dismissing a doctor's petition to restore her blocked account. The court suggested using alternative apps like Zoho's Arattai, emphasizing users must comply with private platform policies.

title: ‚ÄòAllowed only from Oct 18-21‚Äô: SC permits green crackers in Delhi-NCR for Diwali; sets time slots
content: The Supreme Court has permitted the use of green crackers in Delhi and NCR between October 15th and 25th, exclusively at designated locations for Diwali celebrations. Additionally, firecrackers can be burst for one hour in the morning (6-7 am) and two hours in the evening (8-10 pm) on Diwali day.

title: Watch: Video of man begging inside Bengaluru metro goes viral
content: A video of a man begging inside a Namma Metro train has gone viral, showing him soliciting money in the last coach. Metro authorities confirmed that begging is strictly prohibited on their premises and stated that security personnel monitor such activities.

title: Diwali 2025: Festival calendar, dates, significance, and muhurat guide
content: Diwali, the festival of lights, symbolizes the victory of good over evil and knowledge over ignorance. Celebrated over five days starting October 18, 2025, it honors Lord Rama's return and Goddess Lakshmi's blessings. The main Lakshmi Puja occurs on October 20, with specific auspicious timings for prayers.

title: Gold rates today: Price reaches record high; touches Rs 1.27k/ 10 grams
content: Gold prices surged to a record Rs 1,27,500 per 10 grams on MCX, fueled by safe-haven demand amid geopolitical tensions and expectations of US rate cuts. Silver also climbed significantly. Global markets mirrored this trend, with spot gold nearing record highs. Investors are seeking stability as the US Fed signals a cautious approach to interest rates.

title: 5/4! Maharashtra reel vs Kerala in Ranji Trophy opener; disaster for Prithvi Shaw
content: Maharashtra endured a disastrous Ranji Trophy start against Kerala, plummeting to 5/4 early on. Debutant Prithvi Shaw was dismissed for a duck, adding to the team's woes. Despite a recovery led by Ruturaj Gaikwad and Jalaj Saxena, Maharashtra reached 81/5 at lunch, facing an uphill battle in their new season.

title: Why too much calcium can harm your heart: The truth doctors want you to know
content: Calcium is vital for strong bones, but too much from supplements may raise the risk of kidney stones and heart disease. Experts say it‚Äôs time to get calcium from food, not pills.

title: 'I will not contest Bihar polls': Prashant Kishor claims NDA in 'complete chaos'
content: Poll strategist-turned-politician Prashant Kishor will not contest the upcoming Bihar assembly polls, stating the decision was made for the "greater good" of his Jan Suraaj party.  He believes his absence will allow him to focus on organizational work, and remains confident of a significant electoral outcome, either a landslide victory or a substantial defeat.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 25,300; Sensex up around 600 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was above 25,200, BSE Sensex was up almost 300 points.

title: Explainer: Why US may be ready for a trade deal with India now - thanks to China
content: The US is accelerating a trade deal with India to diversify supply chains away from China. This move aims to offer India tariff relief and secure critical inputs, with negotiators addressing familiar friction points in agriculture, digital trade, and intellectual property. Both nations are keen to boost bilateral trade significantly.

title: ‚ÄòCalled anti-Sanatan‚Äô: Gwalior top cop chants ‚ÄòJai Shri Ram‚Äô amid lawyer clash
content: Gwalior witnessed a charged scene Monday evening as a lawyer and a senior police officer exchanged "Jai Shri Ram" slogans near Phoolbagh. Advocate Anil Mishra, leading a Sundar Kand recitation, clashed with DSP Hina Khan over prohibitory orders. Khan's surprising retort to Mishra's accusation of opposing Sanatan Dharma escalated the unusual confrontation, leaving onlookers astonished amidst heightened city security.

title: Women's World Cup: Psychology meets cricket - Pratika Rawal turns theory into runs
content: India's star opener Pratika Rawal masterfully blends her psychology degree with cricket, using self-observation and analysis to excel. Her consistent performance in the Women's ODI World Cup, marked by high scores and an impressive average, showcases her mental fortitude and analytical prowess, making her a standout player.

title: How 5 minutes of daily exercise can improve circulation and protect your heart
content: New research reveals that even five minutes of daily exercise can significantly lower blood pressure. A study found that replacing sedentary time with brief, intense activities like running or cycling reduced both systolic and diastolic readings. These small, consistent increases in movement are crucial for improving cardiovascular health and managing hypertension.

title: Silver shines in 2025! ETFs deliver 102% returns, outpaces gold & equities
content: Silver is 2025's top investment, soaring 102% with prices nearing Rs 1.8 lakh/kg. Analysts predict further gains to Rs 2.46 lakh, driven by green energy and tech demand, outperforming gold and equities. Supply shortages persist, with a projected 118 million-ounce deficit this year, underpinning its fundamental strength.

title: Sultan of Johor Cup: After no handshakes in cricket, India, Pak exchange high 5s - watch video
content: Indian junior hockey players showcased sportsmanship, exchanging greetings with Pakistani counterparts at the Sultan of Johor Cup, a stark contrast to recent cricket team "no handshake" incidents. Despite political tensions, the U-21 hockey teams shared high fives, highlighting a different spirit. The hockey match itself was a thrilling 3-3 draw, with India maintaining their unbeaten streak.

title: Karisma Kapoor‚Äôs kids question Sunjay Kapur‚Äôs father‚Äôs will over gender error
content: New claims emerged in the Delhi High Court regarding the inheritance of Sunjay Kapur. Karisma Kapoor's children are questioning the validity of their father's will. Senior Advocate Mahesh Jethmalani highlighted inconsistencies, including the use of feminine pronouns for Sunjay Kapur. The court also heard arguments about the will's origin and alleged control over the estate.

title: Gold rate prediction: Will prices continue to rise this week? Check outlook
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are poised to potentially surpass $4,200 this week amidst renewed US-China trade tensions and expectations of further US Federal Reserve rate cuts. Despite a strong eight-week rally, downside risks and volatility persist.

title: Bihar polls: Cracks appear in NDA over seat-sharing; RLM's Kushwaha says 'nothing is well'
content: Discontent brews within Bihar's NDA over seat-sharing for upcoming assembly polls. Allies like Upendra Kushwaha and Jitan Ram Manjhi express dissatisfaction, with HAM even announcing plans to contest against Chirag Paswan's LJP. BJP leaders maintain alliance strength, while the opposition Mahagathbandhan criticizes the BJP's intentions.

title: $300m deal: In a first, France's firm eyes India for LNG-powered container ships
content: French shipping giant CMA CGM is eyeing India as a hub for constructing small, LNG-powered container vessels, signing a letter of intent for six ships worth $300 million. This historic deal, following discussions with Prime Minister Modi, marks India's first container ship order from a global mainline operator.

title: US revokes visas of 6 foreigners for Charlie Kirk murder 'celebration'
content: The US State Department revoked visas for six foreigners from Argentina, Brazil, Germany, Mexico, Paraguay, and South Africa for celebrating the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, an ally of President Donald Trump. This action follows Kirk's killing on September 10, with the State Department vowing to remove "aliens" who celebrate the death of Americans and take advantage of US hospitality.

title: ‚ÄòBrics was an attack on dollar‚Äô: Trump explains why he imposed tariffs
content: US President Donald Trump has renewed his tariff threats against Brics, alleging the bloc is "against the dollar" and claiming nations are withdrawing. India, meanwhile, advocates for multilateralism, potentially creating friction with the US. Trump views BRICS' expansion as a direct threat to the dollar's global standing, vowing hefty tariffs on member nations.

title: Illegally kept secret docs, met Chinese officials: Indian-origin US expert arrested ‚Äî what we know
content: An Indian-origin Pentagon contractor and State Department adviser, Ashley Tellis, faces charges for allegedly removing classified Air Force documents. Court records reveal Tellis met extensively with Chinese government officials, discussing sensitive topics like emerging technologies. He is charged with unlawful retention of national defense information, a serious offense with potential prison time and fines.

title: Early detection of prostate cancer could save lives, says Rishi Sunak
content: Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak champions early prostate cancer detection, urging high-risk men, especially Black men and those with a family history, to undergo targeted screening. He emphasizes that proactive checks using MRI scans, PSA tests, and biopsies can lead to effective treatment and prevent unnecessary deaths, encouraging men not to delay seeking medical advice.

title: 'Impossible to fake energy': Musk reverses stance, backs Bitcoin ‚Äî What he said
content: Elon Musk has once again highlighted Bitcoin's energy-backed foundation, contrasting it with easily debased fiat currencies.  This aligns with his long-held view of Bitcoin's intrinsic value.  Despite past environmental concerns with Tesla accepting Bitcoin, both Tesla and SpaceX reportedly hold significant Bitcoin reserves, suggesting continued faith in the cryptocurrency's potential amidst market fluctuations.

title: ‚ÄòSacrificing self to awaken people‚Äô: Another Haryana cop dies by suicide; blames system
content: Another Haryana policeman, ASI Sandeep Kumar, died by suicide, echoing the recent death of IPS officer Y Puran Kumar. Sandeep, who investigated Puran Kumar for corruption, alleged in a note and video that the IPS officer was corrupt and used his influence to cover up wrongdoing.

title: IND vs AUS: Kohli, Rohit depart with team India for Australia white-ball series - Watch
content: India's cricket stars Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are back for the Australian white-ball tour, with Shubman Gill now leading the ODI side. This marks a significant leadership transition as the team gears up for future tournaments. Key players have departed for the series, which includes three ODIs and five T20Is.

title: ‚ÄòThis was scary‚Äô: Travis Kelce‚Äôs head-first fall vs Lions sparks concussion fears
content: Travis Kelce's scary head-first fall during the Chiefs' 30-17 win over the Lions sparked fan concern, with many questioning the lack of immediate concussion evaluation. Despite the alarming incident, Kelce played on, later focusing on the team's tough victory rather than his own safety.

title: Rare earth curbs: US calls India key ally in 'China vs world' battle
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent accused China of "provocative" economic moves after Beijing tightened rare earth mineral export controls. He stated the US and allies will respond collectively to China's "weaponization" of its dominance in these vital materials, asserting sovereignty and de-risking supply chains.

title: Stock recommendations for October 15 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi's Mehul Kothari recommends Premier Energies, SKF India, and JSW Infra for investment today. Premier Energies shows a symmetrical triangle breakout, SKF India a bullish inverse head and shoulder pattern, and JSW Infra a support reversal near its 200-DEMA, indicating potential upside.

title: 'Like Abhishek Sharma': Yashasvi Jaiswal on his path to 'daddy hundreds'
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's exceptional Test scores are drawing praise from cricket legends. His dedication and hard work are key to his success. Jaiswal's ability to convert fifties into hundreds is noteworthy. He has set high standards for himself and continues to impress with his consistent performances. His journey reflects immense sacrifice and a strong work ethic.

title: Trump considering terminating business with China; threatens to end cooking oil trade
content: President Trump accused China of "purposefully" halting soybean purchases, labeling it an "economically hostile act." He stated the US is considering trade termination with Beijing as retribution, emphasizing domestic cooking oil production capabilities. This move follows China's previous use of trade leverage, impacting American soybean farmers.

title: 'Disappointed with Putin': Trump slams Russian President over Ukraine war
content: US President Donald Trump expressed disappointment with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the ongoing war in Ukraine, calling it the most significant event since World War II in terms of casualties. Trump stated he had a good relationship with Putin and questioned why the war continues, noting its negative impact on Russia and its prolonged duration.

title: Bihar polls: JD(U) announces first list of 57 candidates; fields Anant Singh from Mokama
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." Read More

title: NLCS Game 2 takeaways: Top moments and the hero of Dodgers' victory
content: los Angeles Dodgers beat the Milwaukee Brewers 2-0 in the NLCS . defending champs Yoshinobu Yamamoto delivered a complete-game gem . los Angeles' starting pitchers put up two runs in the second inning on Teoscar Hernandez .

title: The race to the 2026 World Cup: Six more teams book their place at the finals
content: all confederations are drawing to a close, but we're still a long way from discovering the full list of 45 nations that will join hosts United States , Mexico and Canada to make up the field of 48 . the final two rounds of the group stage were played, when we discovered the seven nations that joined Morocco and Tunisia, plus interconfederation playoff contenders .

title: Opening night or late-season debuts? Key NBA superstar injury returns to watch for
content: a week away from opening tipoff for the 2025-26 season . a few familiar faces and some new ones ready to take the court starting Oct. 21 . leBron James is expected to sit out three to four weeks .

title: What does Brian Callahan's firing mean for Cam Ward, 1-5 Titans?
content: the Titans fired coach Brian Callahan six games into the season . callahan worked with the likes of peyton Manning, Matthew Stafford , Derek Carr and Joe Burrow . the former Cincinnati Bengals offensive coordinator finished with a 3-14 record in his first season with second-year quarterback .

title: 'Trinidad Magic': Meet the Ole Miss breakout QB even his teammates hadn't heard of
content: the spring transfer portal opened for division II football players in April . co-offensive coordinator Charlie Weis Jr. was glued to the computer screen in his office . "we better get Coach Kiffin," one of them said .

title: Pickups: Vidal steps up; Dart, Darnold being underrated
content: fantasy managers must monitor their status for the upcoming week . each week, before the current NFL week ends, we will identify players available in at least 50% of ESPN standard leagues worthy of your attention . the NFL is a weekly league, and player valuation and roles seldom remain stagnant .

title: Passan: Jorge Polanco has the Mariners on the way to a Hollywood ending
content: Jorge Polanco hits a go-ahead home run in the fifth inning to put the Mariners on top 6-3 . the "Top Gun Anthem" is an epic ballad filled with soaring guitar notes and pick-me-up vibes . it's the perfect soundtrack for this Mariners run, which sees them up two games to none .

title: 14 can't-miss games to watch this November
content: it's a new era of sorts in examining the nonconference portion of the men's college basketball season . a diminished slate of traditional MTEs along with ever-expanding league schedules have combined to change the cadence of marquee matchups . the Big East has done away with both the Gavitt Games (vs. Big Ten) and a mini-challenge against the Big 12 .
